name: Math Foundations of AI
description: This KU covers the fundamental mathematics necessary for understanding and developing artificial intelligence (AI) algorithms and models. It includes essential mathematical concepts such as linear algebra, calculus, probability, and optimization techniques.
outcomes: Define key mathematical concepts used in AI, including linear algebra, calculus, probability, and statistics.
Explain the role of linear algebra in AI algorithms, such as matrix multiplication and transformations.
Describe the importance of probability and statistics in AI, including distributions and statistical measures.
Apply calculus concepts, such as derivatives and integrals, to optimize AI models.
Use discrete mathematics and graph theory in the development of AI algorithms.
Analyze mathematical problems and determine appropriate techniques to solve them in the context of AI.
Examine the application of mathematical optimization techniques in AI models.
Assess the effectiveness of various mathematical techniques in improving AI model performance.
Evaluate the impact of mathematical principles on the development and evaluation of AI algorithms.
Develop mathematical models and algorithms to address complex AI problems.
Construct and implement AI algorithms using fundamental mathematical principles.
notes: Special instructions or explanations: Emphasize the practical applications of mathematical concepts in AI., Integrate hands-on activities to apply mathematical techniques in developing AI models., Provide real-world examples and case studies to illustrate the importance of mathematics in AI.
